subject: Re: Location traffic and Profiles
preview: Hi Una, Regarding the TrustPower case study question, it's behaving like that because there is no Dutch version of the page. Once there is, it will work as expected. And yes, if you want us to put a

full_threads.body:
Hi Una, 

Regarding the TrustPower case study question, it's behaving like that because there is no Dutch version of the page. Once there is, it will work as expected. And yes, if you want us to put a translated article to replace this one, that's fine, just let us know which one? 

Regarding Marina's problem, I think it's occuring because the vast majority of the casestudies are written in either Dutch or English. There are a total of 74 published casestudies, of which 37 are in Dutch and 34 are in English. This means that only a few of them are translated for both languages if that makes sense?

Regarding the team profile images, they loading fine at our end. Can you please let us know if this is still an issue?

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Yeah that’s probably the only way, and you’re right its annoying too as the team in NL believe their numbers have dropped considerably... and I was hoping the analytics could help with this.

Although just looking at the dutch version of the site and there’s a few things that could be skewing the results that we could help with:

When we’re on the Dutch site and click on the Trustpower Case Study, it brings us to the English text but also the English site.
So traffic will have jumped from /nl to /en and then they’re on a different ‘journey’
Is this something we can change easily? Or is it because we don’t have the full translation to the Trustpower Case Study?
Perhaps if we change the headline case study for NL to be a dutch one, that would help?

Also:
Marina in NYC was accessing the dutch site, and once she looked at an English case study she couldn’t see the Dutch ones anymore, even though she goes back to the Dutch website (via the flag)
And even if she selects ‘Nederland’ in the drop-down menu, still doesn’t work.
She even tried opening the website in a different browser, but could only see the English case studies.
Really bizarre, as then I was in the dutch site and couldn’t see the Australian case studies – but then found them under the Asia selector (which I’ll change)
But we’re not sure whats going on with when we go between dutch and English... do you know whats happening here?

Last thing:
We’re all still having issues accessing the profiles pages on our site on both the English and Dutch versions.... Did you get my Loom video on this? And do you know whats happened? Unfortunately it’s having a huge impact on people being able to call us! We also have a few proposals out in the market, and people looking at them will be looking at the team profiles but if they can’t access them then we’re not in a good spot ☹

Cheers
Una

Una Mapes
Marketing Director


Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd
+44 7378 526062 | una@veldhoencompany.com
London | www.veldhoencompany.com


Follow us on



From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Date: Wednesday, 15 May 2019 at 11:46 am
To: Una McGeehan <una@veldhoencompany.com>
Subject: Re: Another one... lil question

Wow!

This is news to me, good find and what a pain at the same time!

You can still gauge how the marketing efforts are performing, but the Coffeyville numbers will skew it yes. The annoying thing is that it sounds like they are real sessions, but Google just isn’t able to determine where the users are coming from.

The idea would be to remove those results and see what is left. I’m thinking this would be the only way to do it?
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU

E. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271





On 15 May 2019, at 5:11 am, Una Mapes <una@veldhoencompany.com> wrote:

Hi Heath

I came across this article which might shed some light on why the majority of our traffic is from Kansas...
Interestingly when we click through ‘kansas’ in our analytics it mentions Coffeyville too.

https://rewind.io/blog/why-am-i-getting-so-much-web-traffic-from-coffeyville-solved/

Does this mean we cant really tell where our traffic is coming from? And if our marketing efforts per region are working?

Cheers
Una

From: Una McGeehan <una@veldhoencompany.com>
Date: Sunday, 12 May 2019 at 8:41 am
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Re: Another one... lil question

That’s absolutely fascinating! As yes previously most of our traffic was from Australia or The Netherlands.... so that’s a huge shift!

I would love to know more about this, as there’s potentially a huge pool of prospects that we could target!
We do find that when the market is still relatively young then we get much more traction with people wanting to know more, compared to the later lifecycle of where we are for Australia and The Netherlands.

But it also makes me wonder would it have anything to do with GDPR or cookie tracking? As it seems like the the Oz and Netherlands audiences have gone down dramatically... and have shifted to become the US audience.

I’ll dig a little deeper into analytics, but I might need your help with this! ☺

Cheers!

Una Mapes
Marketing Director

<image006.png>

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Date: Friday, 10 May 2019 at 7:10 am
To: Una McGeehan <una@veldhoencompany.com>
Subject: Re: Another one... lil question

Hi Una,

No, it has little to do with how the site has been setup. Because it’s a .com, you will list in the US results pages (more so than if it was a .com.au for example). I raised this with the team in your absence and they were adamant that most of the market is in AU and EU when we were discussed where best to host the site. The numbers don’t lie as they say.

I did a quick screen record as there are some interesting results from your US traffic: https://www.loom.com/share/88effdc8f1f44cb6916153b34d88d220

Thanks,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU

E. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271







On 10 May 2019, at 5:57 am, Una Mapes <una@veldhoencompany.com> wrote:

Hi Heath

I was checking our analytics after you sent your Loom video (thanks for that! ☺) and I noticed that the overwhelming majority of visitors are now coming from the US.
Their visits seem to have doubled since this time last year, and the other countries have gone way down... Is there something with how our new site has been set up that’s causing this?

<image001.png>

Would be good to know

Cheers
Una
